pageTitle: Modern Connectivity: Submarine Cables, Mobile, Fiber Expansion (2010–2025)

timeline.title: Rapid Growth
timeline.summary: Internet penetration rises from ~10 % (2012) to around 54 % by 2021; active ISPs grow to over 140; fixed broadband ~3.1 million, mobile broadband ~144 million users in May 2025; operational ISPs ~223 by June 2025

timeline.title: Upgrades to 10 Gbps
timeline.summary: Nayatel expands fiber coverage into Faisalabad (2016), Peshawar (2018); partners with Facebook in 2021 to extend fiber to eight cities; launches 10 Gbps XG‑PON, Fiber‑to‑the‑Tower in 2023; rolls out IPv6 in 2023

timeline.title: Big Achievement
timeline.summary: Pakistan became first South Asian country to test 5G services

timeline.title: Pakistan to Tier‑1 ISP
timeline.summary: Cybernet launches PEACE submarine cable (Tier-1 ISP status November 2022), connecting Pakistan to Europe, Southeast Asia, East Africa and Middle East

timeline.title: PTA’s Web Monitoring System
timeline.summary: PTA commissions a national Web Monitoring System (WMS) using Deep Packet Inspection (Sandvine contract Dec 2018, $18.5M), trial firewall installed July 2023–24, raising issues about slowdown and mass surveillance

timeline.title: Lahore Gets Free Public Wi‑Fi
timeline.summary: In early 2025 Lahore implements free public Wi‑Fi at ~200 locations, especially benefiting students; though concerns remain about infrastructure quality
